tr.td: Concussion (with loss of consciousness of 30 minutes or less)

value.displayName: CONCUSSION WITH BRIEF LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS

translation.displayName: Concussion (with loss of consciousness of 30 minutes or less)

code.displayName: Relevant diagnostic tests and/or laboratory data

td.content: s:male crystallographer aged 37 years presents with mild vomiting since hitting the front of the head a short time ago. he also reports severe headache, moderate nausea, Traumatic Injury - Blunt associated with the mild vomiting. he had LOC 16 min. o:Height 162 cm, Weight 52 kg, Temperature 36.8 C, Pulse 68, SystolicBP 105, DiastolicBP 63, Respiration 14, MRI Brain Unremarkable, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex, appears in NAD, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, Chest = normal breathing sounds B/L, Neuro: WNL a:TBI (concussion) p:administered Flexeril - 10 mg po q 8 hrs PRN pain/cramps, performed MRI Brain, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed, and ordered rest, and referred patient to family practice/primary care.

content2.Unmatched: , MRI Brain Unremarkable , Eyes = normal pupillary reflex , appears

Value.Value: MRI Brain , and performed E/MALE Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed ,

content2.Value: MRI Brain , and performed E/MALE Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed ,

td.content: s:white male aged 37 years returns for f/u approx. one (1) week s/p concussion with LOC 16 min. denies nausea, headache and vomiting. First 24-hour hourly checks were without incident. o:Height 162 cm, Weight 52.2 kg, Temperature 36.8 C, Pulse 68, SystolicBP 105, DiastolicBP 64, Respiration 14, ImPACT test Verbal Memory=96,Visual Memory=95,Processing Speed=44,Reaction Time=0.48, Abd: Scaphoid, soft, ND, NTTP. BS WNL, MS: Extremities x 4 WNL. Strength 5/5, equal bilaterally, Neuro: CN II-XII WNL. No deficits, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex, HEENT: NCAT, PERRL, Neck: Supple, C/V: RRR, Pulm: CTAB. Good effort a:S/P Concussion (with loss of consciousness of 30 minutes or less). No sequelae p:performed ImPACT test, and performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed.

td.content: Do not IV Fluid and Support
